comments.author: ABCbits
comments.body: Quote from: Biat on January 04, 2025, 08:09:09 AMWhat of bitcoin?Some people already makes proposal, but nobody knows which proposal will be used and when it'll be deployed on Bitcoin network. Here are few examples,https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1670https://github.com/chucrut/bips/blob/master/bip-xxxx.mdhttps://mailing-list.bitcoindevs.xyz/bitcoindev/CAEM=y+XyW8wNOekw13C5jDMzQ-dOJpQrBC+qR8-uDot25tM=XA@mail.gmail.com/

comments.author: DediRock
comments.body: Bitcoin may need to adapt if ECDSA deprecation impacts security, but it has mechanisms for upgrades.

comments.author: NotFuzzyWarm
comments.body: Quote from: Biat on January 04, 2025, 08:09:09 AMWhat of bitcoin?Read the document here:https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/ir/2024/NIST.IR.8547.ipd.pdfThis is old news and the topic has already been beaten to death in multiple threads.In short - when finally needed, BTC software will be changed to use PQC hashing algos.

comments.author: john_egbert
comments.body: Quote from: NotFuzzyWarm on January 07, 2025, 01:10:33 AMQuote from: Biat on January 04, 2025, 08:09:09 AMWhat of bitcoin?Read the document here:https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/ir/2024/NIST.IR.8547.ipd.pdfThis is old news and the topic has already been beaten to death in multiple threads.In short - when finally needed, BTC software will be changed to use PQC hashing algos.Yep, and Bitcoin wouldn't be the first targeted even in cases where people are talking about using quantum-ish things to take it out / breach it. Bigger holes would be breached.
